alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole, Orange, northeast Lake, southwest Volusia and northwest Osceola Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms developing from near Orange City to Fern Park to Campbell, as a result of a collision between storms along the west coast sea breeze and the east coast sea breeze. Movement was northeast at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greater Orlando and Sanford, Deltona, Kissimmee and Saint Cloud. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole
